Robertsbridge Abbey
From what remains of Robertsbridge Abbey it is difficult to imagine that this building was part of one of the major Religious foundations in the area. It was built by the Cistercian Order in 1187.The area chosen had to conform to their life style.They needed to be near a river for transport and for the good meadow land as they were mainly sheep farmers. The land was given to them by local landowners and the settlement of Drigsell was depopulated.The people were moved to what is now Robertsbridge.The Abbey became important as a place of work and as a hospital. It was closed in 1538 by Henry V111 and left to decay.
